screen_name: Are masks effective? Some say yes. Others argue they give a false sense of security and cause people to touch their faces more, as well as ignore social distancing guidelines. I don’t have a strong opinion, except to say it’s not unpatriotic or callous to not wear one.

I tested negative for COVID-19 but positive for antibodies, meaning I had the virus but no longer do. I never had any symptoms.

My Uber driver asked me if I was sick and how recently I washed my hands. He seemed satisfied with my answers but kept his head out the window while driving, presumably not to share any air with me. I may or may not have faked a cough before leaving the car.
@NJZ913 @ShoeAct Again, read Rosenberg's book. He explains how morality is a helpful illusion on atheism. There are no objective moral values and duties if God does not exist.

@NJZ913 @ShoeAct It may be beneficial to behave in certain ways—from a survival standpoint—but that doesn't make it objectively morally "good." Evolution doesn't give us real moral obligations. It only provides the illusion of real moral obligations, because that aids in survival.
